intro: Myriopus paniculatus var. paniculatus, commonly known as the panicled myriopus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect stems. The plant produces panicles of small, spikelet-like flowers, which are typically green to reddish in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Myriopus paniculatus var. paniculatus is an important component of the local flora, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
